intro: Nephrodium orientale, commonly known as the oriental nephroid, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive kidney-shaped leaves, which give it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Nephrodiaceae and is known for its striking, waxy foliage that often displays a vibrant green color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Nephrodium orientale is considered a rare and endangered species.
